review: I bought a refurbished unit from amazon to replace the new unit I had bought directly from Roku.  The first unit just wasn't ready for prime time - it's operation was erratic.  The new "refurbished" unit suffers from the same problems.  I have other streaming systems on my TV but Roku offers the most options and my earlier, now discontinued Roku box worked very well.  My TV has built-in Netflix, as does my Apple TV so, with the Roku I had 3 sources for Netflix.  The Roku  Netflix sometimes hangs and buffers; when these problems occur I switch to either of the other sources (all using the same Wifi network) and have no problems.  Surprisingly one of the biggest sources of frustration has been the remote control.  It uses RF instead of infrared (probably because the Roku stick is behind the TV) and should be robust and reliable.  I experienced numerous problems both with the the Roku Stick reliably receiving my button presses and also with the unit misinterpreting commands.  Just before writing this review I tried to reverse a short distance and I couldn't stop it from reversing to the beginning of the movie; I just unplugged the Stick.  I have another Roku stick upstairs and have been more successful with it but still have occasional erratic problems.  So 2 out of 3 Roku sticks have been very erratic and the other occasionally erratic.  If I were to rate this product on the available programming it would be 5 stars, but it ultimately has to be reliable to enjoy that programming and on that criteria I have to rate it as 2 "I don't like it."  Many of the other Amazon reviews cite similar problems; the product needs more development and refinement.  If you do decide to purchase one of these units there is one other limitation to consider.  The stick can be powered by the HDMI port and that was one of the features that attracted me to it.  However, if used that way it has to "boot up" each time the TV is turned on (at least on my TV) and I ultimately found it better to use the power plug that came with the unit so avoid having to start from scratch each time the TV set is turned on.
